This may be better in a blog post, which I will hopefully get to...
but I'd like to pose two questions to the group first.  Let's call it
research.

I've just completed a set of interviews and looking back on the coding
questions.  I realized that I never followed my test first mantra that
I perform at home.

First question, to those giving the interview... Would you ever
suggest/remind a candidate of TDD style in his/her code?

Second question, why on earth does a candidate, like myself, forget to
write tests and incrementally improve their code?  Do this show a lack
of software development maturity?

As a community reminder, and to myself.... don't forget TDD style on interviews.
